channel.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
channel.description:
Right, there are a billion wikis already, so here's another one for the pile:
http://www.moparisthebest.net/
Current goal is to try and fill up as much info as possible about bots and communities from the past and the present.
If you have information on individuals, get that in there too!

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Alright, the transfer for moparisthebest.net went through (thanks eXemplar!), so as root DNS servers update http://moparisthebest.net will forward here instead of the wiki, wiki.moparisthebest.(com|org|net|info|biz) will forward to the wiki, but mopman has to update his server to use the new address, so everyone bug him!

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:28, topic:369721”]Going back so far will be quite difficult -.-, luckily I remembered Reines wrote a brief history of reinet. Along with that it has links to older communities that we can also expand upon. (Anybody remember Bobdole’s bot on Codestream? :P)

http://web.archive.org/web/20080223232548/http://reinet.co.uk/

[quote]RSCN [rscheatnet.com]
Script-Dump [scriptdump.net]
Autorune LTD [autoruneltd.co.uk]
The Intensity [theintensity.com]
Codestream [codestream.org]
RSCLabs [rsclabs.com]
SBot198 [sbot198.com]
Sythe [sythe.org]
3rxnet [3rxnet.org]
Kaitnieks.com [kaitnieks.com][/quote][/quote]I can remember most of those sites but couldn’t think of anything to post about them really (eg. 3rxnet, there were some bots but they only had like 30 users), so the only community I created a page for was Reinet.

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

moparisthebest, I’ve ported across all the black books

Does anyone see anything else in the wiki at:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/wiki/
That should be ported over to the new wiki before I delete it and forward the address? I’ll give it about a day and I’ll remove + forward. (to wiki.moparisthebest.(com|org|net) Mopman! Fix it! ;))

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

I own the domain - It was only registered in the last few months, but my current registrar is crap so it’s in a transferral limbo going to my new registrar at the moment. Mopman currently hosts the domain.

Happy to talk transferral/redirection.

Read full topic

Well, you have to ask mopman about that

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

vortex:

So, now we have two wikis competing against each other? coolio

Well, the one I host has been there for years, but is hardly used, and I have no time or will to run it (though I’d be more than happy to give someone else sufficient privileges to). The moparisthebest.net one is new, and I’m not entirely sure who runs it or who owns moparisthebest.net, or if they are the same person. If they want to continue running it, I’d be more than happy to shut down mine, redirect it there, and give them full use of wiki.moparisthebest.com or whatever. I’d also like them to sell me moparisthebest.net so I can forward it correctly just like moparisthebest.org is done.

Read full topic

[/quote]what can i say, im awesome

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Maybe a PDF document introducing the various technologies used for accessing the client (BCEL/ASM/reflection/agents) would be ideal if compiled by the right people.

Unlike a wiki, the content is directly controlled and subject to scrutiny before publishing. Wikipedia, on the other hand, is an endless war between those who know and those who think they know making edits to a page, which ends up being reverted countless times before being locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

maybe it was someone else then I know someone started writing some new chapters at some point.

PaulT started writing new chapters, I’m pretty sure the topic is on the General Discussion board.

Anyway, @mopman, I’ve set up an A record for wiki.moparisthebest.com pointing towards your site, if you want to set it up to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Cheating Wiki
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:10, topic:369721”][quote author=sppt link=topic=465847.msg3406887#msg3406887 date=1290381851]
I personally think someone should rewrite the blackbook, because it is pretty bad and missing out on things.
It’s just a matter of finding people who want to do it and have enough spare time!
[/quote]
didn’t cows come around at some point last year said he would be writing more and vanished.[/quote]

MoparWiki

The black book is an out of date mess. If you want a useful guide to cheating, you’d be better off starting from scratch - or at least from some other document.

[quote=“Brazen Bull, post:16, topic:137697”]Nice Mopar.

Now we need an absolute beginner’s guide to cheating, that can also lead into whatever direction the cheater wants to go in. Then once it’s prominently linked, you can start converting new hits on your site straight into new cheaters Hopefully many of them would also find the wiki a better way to find answers than spamming the forum.

I hope your wiki goes well. If it was back in the day, I would help you all I could.[/quote]

Doesn’t look like he has much interest to do it at all.

Read full topic

item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

we have our own wiki :)… which seems to be fucked up right now :(.

Parse error: syntax error, unexpected T_NAMESPACE, expecting T_STRING in /home/mopar/htdocs/moparisthebest.com/wiki/includes/Namespace.php on line 44

um… mopar help!!!

Well anyway, once that’s fixed you can copy and paste the black books from there (it’s wikitext’d).
